Sentencas: Isotope exchange depth profiling and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy are usually regarded as complementary tools for measuring the surface oxygen exchange activity of mixed conducting oxides, for example used in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrodes.
Titulo: Water-Induced Decoupling of Tracer and Electrochemical Oxygen Exchange Kinetics on Mixed Conducting Electrodes

Sentencas: Only very few studies compared electrical (k(q)) and tracer (k*) exchange coefficients of solid-gas interfaces measured under identical conditions.
Titulo: Water-Induced Decoupling of Tracer and Electrochemical Oxygen Exchange Kinetics on Mixed Conducting Electrodes

Sentencas: The 1:1 correlation between k(q) and k* often made is thus more an assumption than experimentally verified.
Titulo: Water-Induced Decoupling of Tracer and Electrochemical Oxygen Exchange Kinetics on Mixed Conducting Electrodes

Sentencas: In this study it is shown that the measured rates of electrical and tracer exchange of oxygen may strongly differ.
Titulo: Water-Induced Decoupling of Tracer and Electrochemical Oxygen Exchange Kinetics on Mixed Conducting Electrodes

Sentencas: Simultaneous acquisition of k(q) and k* on La0.6Sr0.4FeO3.delta and SrTi0.3FeO3.delta thin film electrodes revealed that k* > 100 k(q) in humid oxidizing (O-16(2) + (H2O)-O-18) and humid reducing (H-2 + (H2O)-O-18) atmospheres.
Titulo: Water-Induced Decoupling of Tracer and Electrochemical Oxygen Exchange Kinetics on Mixed Conducting Electrodes

Sentencas: These results are explained by fast water adsorption and dissociation on surface oxygen vacancies, forming two surface hydroxyl groups.
Titulo: Water-Induced Decoupling of Tracer and Electrochemical Oxygen Exchange Kinetics on Mixed Conducting Electrodes

Sentencas: Hence, interpreting experimentally determined k* values in terms of electrochemically relevant oxygen exchange is not straightforward.
Titulo: Water-Induced Decoupling of Tracer and Electrochemical Oxygen Exchange Kinetics on Mixed Conducting Electrodes
